main event: A witness reported seeing a luminous object rapidly descending in the sky for 2-3 seconds on June 17, 1960 in Littleton, Colorado.
interesting points: The object was observed at an elevation of 50-60 degrees and an azimuth of 280-360 degrees, moving rapidly downward.
The witness was not an astronomer but had an astronomy acquaintance who studied UFOs.
The witness felt the object was not a falling star due to its brightness decreasing rapidly.
The witness was asked to complete an Air Force Questionnaire for further investigation.
The sighting was reported to the Investigations Center at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
